intro: Hancea muricata, commonly known as the roughleaf hancea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Hancea muricata is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
